item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：中国正考虑就恒大审计问题对普华永道处以创纪录罚款
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四报道，中国正在考虑对普华永道会计师事务所（PwC）处以创纪录的罚款，并暂停该审计机构在当地的部分业务，原因是普华永道在审计陷入困境的房地产开发商中国恒大集团时扮演了重要角色。【原文：China is weighing a record fine for PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP (PwC) and suspending some of the auditor's local operations over its role in auditing troubled property developer China Evergrande Group , Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 鞋类需求强劲，Birkenstock 上调年度收入预期
item.description: Birkenstock 周四上调了年度收入预期，这家德国凉鞋制造商押注于全价销售带来的好处，以及对其封闭式鞋头轮廓和软木凉鞋的强劲需求。【原文：Birkenstock raised its annual revenue forecast on Thursday, as the German sandal maker bets on benefits from full-price selling and strong demand for its closed-toe silhouettes and cork-based sandals.】

item.title: 亚马逊在美国的网站和应用程序中新增 Grubhub 食品配送服务
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）周四表示，其美国客户现在可以直接在其购物应用程序和网站上向 Grubhub 下订单，从而扩大了其 Prime 会员免费使用 Grubhub+ 会员资格的协议。【原文：Amazon.com on Thursday said its customers in the U.S. can now order from Grubhub directly on its shopping app and the website, extending a deal that already offers its Prime members a no-fee access to Grubhub+ membership.】

item.title: 人民币贬值，全球基金在中国飞速发展
item.description: 由于人民币贬值和脆弱的经济推动了对外国资产的需求，全球基金在中国的发行量创下了历史新高，这是国内投资者信心不足的最新迹象。【原文：Global fund launches in China have hit a record as a weakening yuan and fragile economy drive demand for foreign assets, in the latest sign of low confidence among domestic investors.】

item.title: 大众汽车经销商 D'Ieteren 表示北美地区汽车玻璃维修需求疲软
item.description: 比利时汽车分销商 D'Ieteren 周三公布了 30.6 亿欧元（33.0 亿美元）的第一季度销售额，并指出由于天气较温和，其在北美的汽车玻璃维修业务量有所下降。【原文：Belgian car distributor D'Ieteren on Wednesday reported 3.06 billion euros ($3.30 billion) in first-quarter sales and flagged lower volumes for its auto glass repair business in North America due to milder weather.】

item.title: 瑞银在高管调整中分拆财富管理职能
item.description: 瑞士联合银行（UBS）周四表示，将分拆其最高财富管理部门，这是该银行执行董事会调整的一部分，同时还将任命新的投资银行负责人。【原文：UBS said on Thursday it would split its top wealth management role as part of a shake-up of the Swiss bank's executive board that also sees new heads of its investment bank.】

item.title: 邮轮运营商提供夏季折扣，邮轮挤满加勒比海和阿拉斯加
item.description: 据旅行社和公司网站报道，皇家加勒比、嘉年华和挪威邮轮控股公司正在对夏季航线打折，以填补空缺的舱位。【原文：Cruise operators Royal Caribbean , Carnival and Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings are discounting summer itineraries as they look to fill empty cabins, according to travel agencies and company websites.】

item.title: 降息押注减弱，最大月度债券供应考验市场
item.description: 6 月份，全球债券市场将面临今年迄今为止最大的主权债券净发行量，而经济数据又使降息成疑，这考验着投资者迄今为止对债务的强烈偏好。【原文：Global bond markets face the biggest amount of net sovereign issuance so far this year in June, just as economic data throws rate cuts into doubt, testing investors' so-far strong appetite for the debt.】

item.title: 洞察：中国电动汽车制造商如何打败特斯拉和欧洲传统汽车制造商
item.description: 从 20 世纪 80 年代开始，欧洲汽车制造商逐步征服了中国，在中国市场几乎没有竞争对手的情况下，取得了数百万的销售业绩。【原文：Starting in the 1980s, European automakers steadily conquered China, racking up millions in sales with little local competition.】

item.title: 新西兰政府适度减税并降低支出，经济步履维艰
item.description: 新西兰政府周四概述了经济疲软、失业率上升和资产负债表疲软的情况，政府提供了适度的税收减免，但降低了新的支出，并因忽视该国的土著居民而受到批评。【原文：New Zealand’s government on Thursday outlined a soft economy, rising unemployment and a weaker balance sheet as it delivered modest tax relief but lowered new spending and faced criticism for neglecting the country’s Indigenous population.】

item.title: 丰田 4 月全球销量下降，中国和日本跌幅居前
item.description: 丰田汽车公司 4 月份的全球产销量与去年同期相比有所下降，主要原因是中国市场的价格战激烈，以及日本部分车型停产和小型车部门安全测试丑闻导致的产销量下降。【原文：Toyota Motor's April global sales and production fell from a year earlier, hurt by an intense price war in China and a decline in Japan after a production stoppage of some models and a safety test scandal at its small car unit.】

item.title: 早间竞标数据转储前的等待时间
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: 路透社调查显示：中国5月工厂活动可能稳步扩张，经济复苏依然脆弱
item.description: 路透社周四的一项民意调查显示，中国5月份制造业活动的增长速度可能与上月相仿，当时中国制造业勉强保持了扩张态势。【原文：China's manufacturing activity in May likely grew at a similar pace to the previous month when it barely managed to stay expansionary, a Reuters poll showed on Thursday, reinforcing the fragile nature of the recovery in the world's No.2 economy.】

item.title: 索尼认为随着动漫走向世界，流媒体服务 Crunchyroll 将推动增长
item.description: 索尼公司电影业务主管周四表示，索尼将其动漫流媒体服务 Crunchyroll 视为增长动力，该集团希望借助动漫在日本以外地区的发展。【原文：Sony sees its anime streaming service Crunchyroll as a growth driver, the head of its movies business said on Thursday, as the group looks to ride the growth of anime outside Japan.】

item.title: 谷歌将在马来西亚投资 20 亿美元建设数据中心和云服务
item.description: Alphabet 旗下公司谷歌（Google）周四表示，将在马来西亚投资 20 亿美元，在该国开发首个数据中心和谷歌云（Google Cloud）区域，这是全球科技公司向东南亚扩张浪潮中的最新举措。【原文：Google will invest $2 billion in Malaysia to develop its first data centre and Google Cloud region in the country, the unit of Alphabet said on Thursday, the latest in a wave of expansion by global tech firms into Southeast Asia.】

item.title: 日元持续下滑激发日本对结构性改革的兴趣
item.description: 日本决策者正将注意力转向日元持续下跌背后更多的结构性经济因素，他们深信市场干预在扭转货币大范围下滑方面能力有限。【原文：Japanese policymakers are turning their attention to more structural economic factors behind persistent yen declines, convinced that market intervention is limited in its ability to reverse the currency's broader slide.】

item.title: 股票和债券因全球利率忧虑而下滑
item.description: 周四，亚洲股市一片红海，债券下跌，因为投资者押注全球利率将在更长时间内保持较高水平，并期待本周末的关键通胀数据为货币政策的未来走向提供进一步线索。【原文：Asian stocks were a sea of red on Thursday and bonds slid on bets global interest rates would stay higher for longer, as investors looked to key inflation readings at the end of the week for further clues on the future path of monetary policy.】

item.title: 索尼强调 PlayStation 用户参与度，因为硬件销售逐渐减少
item.description: 日本索尼公司周四强调，随着 PlayStation 5 游戏机的销量逐渐减少，索尼游戏平台的用户参与度也越来越高，索尼公司正在寻找经常性收入。【原文：Japan's Sony on Thursday emphasised the strength of user engagement with its gaming platform as sales of the PlayStation 5 console taper off and companies in the sector look for recurring revenue.】

item.title: 中国企业在日本式改革中急于提高股息和回购股票
item.description: 中国上市公司正急于回购股票和提高股息，以响应监管机构的号召，这与日本和韩国的改革努力不谋而合。【原文：Chinese listed companies are rushing to buy back shares and lift dividends as they respond to regulators' calls that echo reform efforts in Japan and South Korea, driving a welcome rally even if investors doubt that broader governance changes are afoot.】

item.title: 美国收益率飙升刺激避险需求，美元走高
item.description: 周四，美元兑主要货币汇率飙升至两周高点，原因是美国国债收益率上升和避险资产需求增加导致国债溃败，从而提高了美元的吸引力。【原文：The dollar soared to a two-week high against its major peers on Thursday, as a rout in Treasuries improved the currency's allure due to both higher U.S. yields and demand for safe haven assets.】

item.title: 市场等待美国原油库存数据，油价因需求低迷而下跌
item.description: 油价周四下跌，因为市场在等待最新的美国原油库存数据，而美国经济活动的恢复表明借贷成本将在更长时间内保持较高水平，这可能会打击需求。【原文：Oil prices were down on Thursday as the markets wait on the latest U.S. crude oil stockpiles data while resilient U.S. economic activity pointed to borrowing costs staying higher for longer in a potential blow to demand.】

item.title: 矿业巨头退出 490 亿美元的盎格鲁收购交易后，必和必拓股价下跌
item.description: 矿业巨头必和必拓集团放弃了以 490 亿美元收购竞争对手英美资源集团（Anglo American）的计划，为期六周的收购计划暂时告一段落，该公司在澳大利亚上市的股票周四下跌 1.5%。【原文：The Australian-listed shares of BHP Group fell 1.5% on Thursday after the mining giant walked away from its $49 billion plan to take over rival Anglo American , ending for now its six-week pursuit.】

item.title: Palantir 赢得美国陆军 4.8 亿美元的 "Maven "原型机交易
item.description: 美国国防部周三表示，Palantir 赢得了美国陆军一份价值 4.8 亿美元的合同，合同内容是提供名为 Maven 智能系统的原型机。【原文：Palantir has won a $480 million contract from the U.S. Army for a prototype known as the Maven Smart System, the Defense Department said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 沃尔玛称因技术问题部分美国商店多收了顾客的钱
item.description: 沃尔玛周三表示，3 月中旬出现的一个技术问题导致该零售商在美国的一些商店向顾客多收费用。【原文：Walmart said on Wednesday that a technical issue in mid-March resulted in the retailer overcharging customers at some stores in the United States.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，佩尔茨的特里安公司抛售迪士尼股票
item.description: 据 CNBC 周三援引知情人士的话报道，亿万富翁纳尔逊-佩尔茨（Nelson Peltz）的特里亚基金管理公司（Trian Fund Management）在与媒体巨头华特-迪士尼（Walt Disney）的董事会争斗之后，已经解散了所持股份。【原文：Billionaire Nelson Peltz's Trian Fund Management has dissolved its stake in Walt Disney after a boardroom battle with the media giant, CNBC news reported on Wednesday, citing a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 早间投标全球收益率飙升削弱风险偏好
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 泰森食品公司被保守派团体指控雇用移民多于美国公民
item.description: 由前特朗普政府官员成立的一个组织周三指责泰森食品公司歧视美国公民，过多地雇用移民，包括儿童和非法入境者。【原文：A group founded by former Trump administration officials accused Tyson Foods on Wednesday of discriminating against U.S. citizens by disproportionately hiring immigrants, including children and people in the country illegally.】

item.title: 波音公司称在 737 MAX 防冰发动机问题上取得进展
item.description: 波音公司周三表示，正在制定永久性解决方案，以解决737 MAX防冰系统可能过热并导致发动机故障的问题。【原文：Boeing said Wednesday it is making progress on developing a permanent solution to address an issue with the 737 MAX anti-ice system that can overheat and could cause an engine failure.】

item.title: 美国之鹰公司季度收入不及预期
item.description: 美国鹰服装公司（American Eagle Outfitters）周三的季度收入未能达到华尔街的预期，原因是持续的通货膨胀损害了消费者对通常以全价出售的服装和配饰的需求。【原文：American Eagle Outfitters on Wednesday missed Wall Street estimates for quarterly revenue as sticky inflation hurt consumer demand for its apparel and accessories often sold at full price.】

item.title: 惠普个人电脑需求复苏，营收超出预期
item.description: 惠普公司周三公布的第二季度营收超出华尔街预期，表明随着客户升级系统，个人电脑（PC）市场正在复苏。【原文：HP Inc beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter revenue on Wednesday, signaling a recovery in the personal computer (PC) market as customers upgrade their systems.】
